cab.content: This DocuPftehi: Is the Property o'1H:o Orltannio jfc$jbs*'y'5 GovernmentQ^j^Vrom Viceroy, Foreign and Political Department, iSth May 1919.(Received 19th May, 9 p.m.)Secret. Afghanistan. Your telegram of the .8th May. 116 Austrian and 12 Russians and Poles, including two women and four children, arrived at Landi Kotal from Kabul on 30th April. Austrians were mostly non-commissioned officers and men. They have been interned at Ahmednagar, and Russians sent to Bombay for repatriation via Vladivostok at first opportunity. According to present information only seven officers and 10 non-commissioned officers remain at Kabul, and two non-commissioned officers at Herat. These may include a few Germans as well as Austrians. The omission to report arrival of this party is regretted.
